text: Argyrosomus japonicus, also known as the Japanese meagre or mulloway, is a species of meagre in the family Sciaenidae. Its otoliths are prized as "jewels" by some fishers. == Description == Argyrosomus japonicus can be silver to muted teal. It grows up to 2 m (6 ft 7 in). Its head is copper- colored. The caudal fin is angular in juveniles but becomes more rounded in larger fish. == Image gallery == == References == # Froese, Rainer; Pauly, Daniel (eds.) (2020). "Argyrosomus japonicus" in FishBase. December 2020 version. Category:Ray-finned fish
title: Argyrosomus japonicus
